Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Okay, let me tackle this loan application process problem step by step. The user wants me to analyze three case logs against both strict normative rules and recommended desiderata. First, I need to clearly separate the two parts: the strict rules (Part 1) that must never be violated, and the recommended best practices (Part 2) that can be ignored without serious consequences.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at Case 1: - Starts with Application Received at 09:00 - Then Credit Check at 09:30 (good, within 24h window) - Risk Assessment at 10:00 (after credit check, good) - Loan Decision Approved at 11:00 - Inform Applicant at 13:00 (4 hours after decision, which is under 48h recommended) - Finalize Documentation at 13:30 (before close case, perfect for approval) - Close Case at 14:00 This case looks completely compliant. No issues here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 2 jumps out immediately: - Application Received at 08:00 - But next activity is Risk Assessment at 08:20 - thats a major problem! The norm says Credit Check must come BEFORE Risk Assessment. Here they did Risk Assessment first, which violates the sequence rule. - Then Credit Check happens at 09:00 (too late, but not the main issue) - Loan Decision Rejected at 09:30 - BUT they did Finalize Documentation at 10:00 AFTER rejection! Thats explicitly forbidden - the rules say do not finalize documentation after a rejection. So Case 2 has two critical violations: 1. Risk Assessment before Credit Check (sequence violation) 2. Finalizing documentation after rejection (contradictory action)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Case 3 has some timing issues: - Credit Check happened at 2024-01-14 10:00, which is 5 days after Application Received (Jan 12 09:00) - thats way over the 24h desideratum - Inform Applicant at 2024-01-16 15:00, which is 4 days after loan decision (Jan 14 12:00) - exceeds the 48h recommendation - No Follow-up Call mentioned (desideratum violation) But importantly, the sequence is correct: Application Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Finalize Close So no normative rule violations here - just desiderata misses.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I should double-check the desiderata part. The user specified that timing recommendations (like 24h for credit check, 48h for informing) and follow-up calls are not strict but preferred. So Case 3s delays are suboptimal but not violations.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For justifications: - Case 2s Risk Assessment before Credit Check might be a system glitch where the credit check module failed to run, so they manually skipped it. But the rules say no skipping, so this is still invalid. - Case 2s documentation after rejection is clearly a mistake - probably someone thought were closing the case but didnt check the decision type.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: The user seems to be testing if I can distinguish between hard rules and soft recommendations. Theyre likely in process compliance or system design, given the technical nature. Ill make sure to emphasize that Case 2 has serious rule breaches while Case 3 is just suboptimal.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Final check: - Case 1: no violations - Case 2: two normative violations - Case 3: desiderata violations only I think that covers everything. Time to structure the response clearly.
